result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian L Odoms was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at the rate of $50 per month commencing 12-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 10 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Adrian L Odoms in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.

State moves to amend from a Felony to a Misdemeanor.
Defense has no objections.
Amended Information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine: $505
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 12/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  10 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   
Defendant Adrian L Odoms did not appear (defendant did notify the court he was unable to get a ride here).

MANDATORY APPEARANCE BY THE DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED OR A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED.
